plants.name: Helianthus annuus
plants.description: A tall annual plant known for its large, bright yellow flower heads that follow the sun's movement. Widely cultivated and also found wild, sunflowers typically bloom in mid to late summer.
plants.funFact: The sunflower's head is actually composed of hundreds of tiny flowers called florets, each capable of producing a seed.

plants.name: Lupinus polyphyllus
plants.description: Perennial herbaceous plant with spikes of pea-like flowers often found in shades of purple, blue, pink, or white. They thrive in temperate climates and are common in meadows and along roadsides.
plants.location: Pacific Northwest (USA), parts of Europe and New Zealand (introduced)
plants.funFact: Lupines enrich soil by fixing nitrogen, benefiting nearby plants and ecosystems.

plants.name: Plumeria rubra
plants.description: Tropical deciduous tree known for its highly fragrant and colorful flowers, often used in Hawaiian leis. Blooms profusely in warm climates during late summer.
plants.location: Tropical Americas, cultivated in tropical regions worldwide
plants.funFact: Frangipani flowers close at night and open anew in the morning, releasing their sweet fragrance in the evening.

plants.name: Alstroemeria aurea
plants.description: A bushy perennial with lily-like flowers marked with streaks and spots. It thrives in temperate South American climates and blooms in late summer.
plants.funFact: Alstroemeria flowers are popular in floral arrangements because of their long vase life and vibrant colors.
